para.p: Vector space: (V,+,⋅) with ten axioms
Subspace: a subset of a vector space that is a vector space on its own.
Recall that to ensure that a subset ⊆SV is a subspace of V, we must have that
S is nonempty.
S is closed under addition.
S is closed under scalar multiplication.
These last two items can be understood as S being closed under linear combinations. That is, S is a subspace if for every ∈→u,→vS and ∈c1,c2R (scalars), then ∈+⁢c1→u⁢c2→vS.
